title: 6 Quick Steps to Change the Subtitle Color in VLC Media Player

steps.title: Launch VLC Media Player on your computer.
steps.content: Launch VLC Media Player on your computer. Search for VLC in the Start menu or open a media file with VLC Player. If you don't have the VLC Media Player app on your computer, go to www.videolan.org/vlc and download and install the app.

steps.title: Click on Tools from the menu bar.
steps.content: Click on Tools from the menu bar. You'll see a drop-down menu after doing so. Select Preferences from the list. Alternatively, press Ctrl + P on your keyboard to quickly access the Preferences tab.

steps.title: Click on the Subtitles / OSD option from the upper section.
steps.content: Click on the Subtitles / OSD option from the upper section. This will open the Subtitle & On Screen Display Settings .

steps.title: Navigate to the Text default color option.
steps.content: Navigate to the Text default color option. Click on the white colour box to view the font colour adjust box.

steps.title: Select a colour from the box and click on the OK button.
steps.content: Select a colour from the box and click on the OK button. You can also use the HTML colour codes here.

steps.title: Don't forget to click on the Save button.
steps.content: Don't forget to click on the Save button. Now enjoy the movie with your favourite coloured subtitles! Also, learn how to adjust subtitle and voice delay on VLC Media Player.
